column3: btw, hopefully the nit was solved
hahaha, yeah let's leave a memepool structure for another PR. fixed
nit: There is trailing whitespace, causing issues with some editors. We don't have this rule in the developer notes, but good to keep in mind for the future.

Mixed feelings when reading the note, I thought an unspent output is never spent weather the transaction is in the mempool or not, otherwise is not an unspent output.\n\nSuggestion, remove `unspent`: `Note that an output that is spent in the mempool isn't listed`.

Perhaps it is time to add it to the notes. Is is save right now to have your editor configured to remove all trailing whitespaces in any file you save in the project now?\nI remember when that wouldn't be save in the sense that your +14-5 commit would turn into +60-50 or something.\n
"unspent output" refers to the chainstate, whereas "spent in the mempool" has no effect on the chainstate. Imo it is fine.
